image.altText: A graphic featuring a woman with blonde hair, a sign for Philosopher Falls, a fern and a faint map.

props.synopsis: More than two years after Belgian backpacker Celine Cremer vanished near Philosopher Falls, new discoveries have helped investigators better understand her final movements — though many questions still remain.

title.children: How will the new discoveries impact the search for Belgian backpacker Celine Cremer?

image.altText: Two air attendants pour water bottles over a burnt backpack in an overhead locker.

props.synopsis: The national transport safety regulator's report into a fire, which broke out on a flight to Tasmania earlier this year, has found the blaze was caused by a lithium-ion battery experiencing "thermal runaway".

title.children: Safety report released into overhead locker fire on Australian flight

image.altText: A fire vehicle at a roundabout and locals gathered on the side of the road watching.

props.synopsis: Police and other emergency services are responding to a chemical spill in George Town where a quantity of formic acid has been spilled.

title.children: Acid spill leads to evacuations of George Town school and locals

image.altText: A man with a white beard and glasses stares off to the side.

props.synopsis: Long-term residents of Tasmanian caravan parks would be protected from unlimited rent increases and no-grounds evictions and be able to sell their homes under draft legislation.

title.children: 'Long overdue': Caravan park resident welcomes draft protections

image.altText: Semi-automatic hunting rifle, generic image.

props.synopsis: As state and territory leaders consider tougher gun laws, the Tasmanian government is under pressure from interest groups and advocates on all sides of the debate.

title.children: Don't rush to change gun laws, farmers and shooters group in Tasmania says

image.altText: Woman sits at table, holding a basketball, posing for a photo

props.synopsis: After almost 20 years working in men's sport, Christine Finnegan says the time is right for her to leave the NBL club she lead to championship glory, and move into a solely women's sport role.

title.children: 'Leadership can be lonely': Top JackJumpers exec on calling it quits

image.altText: Australia bowler Pat Cummins clenches both fists as he shouts and celebrates with teammate Marnus Labuschagne.

props.synopsis: The circus comes to town in Adelaide with technological madness marring a second day which, more importantly, saw England wilt again and Australia tighten its grip on the Ashes.

title.children: Snicko circus distracts as England slides towards Ashes oblivion

image.altText: Woman with curly hair on her haunches with head in hands in front of floral tributes.

props.synopsis: Jewish Australians say the terror attack at Bondi Beach has left the community feeling angry, devastated and scared.

title.children: Australian Jews say years of rising antisemitism culminated in Bondi attack

image.altText: Two bare single beds in a small hotel room, separated by a tiny bedside table.

props.synopsis: Alleged terrorists Naveed and Sajid Akram spent almost a month holed up in a small hotel room in a city in the southern Philippines in the lead-up to the attack, local staff have said.

title.children: Inside room 315, where hotel staff say gunmen spent most of November

image.altText: A woman's silhouette as she texts on a phone while standing in front of a big image of an X.

props.synopsis: US social media platform X incentivised the spread of inflammatory misinformation in the wake of the Bondi Beach shootings, a digital media expert has said.

title.children: Why social media was flooded with lies after the Bondi shooting

image.altText: A man wearing a white shirt and navy jacket.

props.synopsis: The former member for Dobell, Craig Thomson, has been sentenced to a maximum of four years jail over a migration scheme that netted him $2 million and for fraudulently receiving the JobKeeper payment.

title.children: Former Labor MP Craig Thomson jailed over migration fraud

image.altText: Firefighters worked to contain the blaze for around three hours at the Little Street site.

props.synopsis: A NSW oyster grower is left reeling after tens of thousands of dollars' worth of equipment went up in flames just a week away from Christmas.

title.children: Firefighters deem 'ferocious' 30m tall blaze at oyster farm suspicious

image.altText: A woman with a checkered shirt wearing a fixed microphone speaks at a conference

props.synopsis: The chief executive of Perth-based oil and gas producer Woodside, Meg O'Neill, resigns from the company effective immediately in order to take up the same role at BP.

title.children: Meg O'Neill resigns as Woodside chief to join energy giant

image.altText: Members of the public at a crowded beach during sunset.

props.synopsis: With only seven more sleeps until the big day, Western Australia looks like being the hottest capital city in the nation this Christmas.

title.children: Perth to swelter on Christmas Day with scorcher tipped

image.altText: A close up of Susie Wiles sitting at a table listening.

props.synopsis: The long-time political operator is unusually candid during a series of interviews with magazine Vanity Fair.

title.children: Who is Susie Wiles and why has she caused panic in Trump land?

image.altText: Dan Bongino looks to his side with wide eye, US flag behind, red tie, blue suit. His head is shaved.

props.synopsis: FBI deputy director Dan Bongino will step down from his post next month, ending a short but tumultuous tenure as the bureau's second-highest-ranking official.

title.children: FBI deputy to step down from role less than a year after appointment

image.altText: Scene from The Family Stone

props.synopsis: While your Instagram feed says the holidays are about joy and love, for many people Christmas is a time of managing tricky family members, inappropriate comments and probing questions.

title.children: Dreading family Christmas conversations? These strategies can help

image.altText: Albanese holds up a Medicare card.

props.synopsis: Labor has two options when it comes to straddling a budget in the red and accusations it has become a green Grinch on health funding.

title.children: Party allegiance counts for little when there's $121 billion worth of problems

image.altText: A man standing on a sunny cliff in the city with water behind him

props.synopsis: A man who showed no remorse after a stabbing attack on his partner in their south Sydney home is sentenced to more than 26 years in jail for the woman's murder.

title.children: Man jailed for 'cowardly and inexcusable' murder of partner

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair in a paramedic uniform sits on a couch holding a baby in her arms.

props.synopsis: Rachel Szigeti was preparing to leave for the hospital to give birth to her second baby when she realised the moment had suddenly arrived. That was when her husband Cedric sprang into action and called paramedics.

title.children: NSW paramedics reunite with baby they unexpectedly delivered at home

image.altText: A big vehicle in army colours of khaki and grey.

props.synopsis: The United States has approved its largest ever weapons package for Taiwan which is under increasing military pressure from China.

title.children: US approves largest ever weapons spending for Taiwan

image.altText: exterior of hospital building

props.synopsis: An inquest has been examining the death of a newborn at Atherton Hospital and whether the care the mother and baby received were in any way responsible.

title.children: Nothing could have been done in 'rare, tragic' baby death, inquest hears

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Kerry Schott's report into the Triple Zero outage debacle increases pressure on Optus to implement 21 recommendations, some of them "urgent", and highlights numerous errors.

title.children: Optus in race against time after damning Triple Zero outage review

image.altText: A photo of a man and woman in front of a Zone RV caravan.

props.synopsis: People who fully paid before the company collapsed can receive their vans if they pay an extra fee, while the majority of customers remain in limbo.

title.children: Administrators allow some Zone RV customers to collect caravans

image.altText: portrait of a man in a breezeway.

props.synopsis: Cases of melioidosis in Cairns have set records this year, and authorities are uncertain why. But one survivor has joined a campaign to start a conversation about safety as the rains return in the north.

title.children: Health authorities rebrand tropical disease after cases increase fourfold

image.altText: a teenage girl being kissed on the cheek by her mum and brother

props.synopsis: It marks the end of a tumultuous schooling period — marked by extreme weather and a pandemic along the way — and many are celebrating.

title.children: 'Surreal experience' as Saathvika receives top ATAR of 99.95

image.altText: Craig Freeman leaving court

props.synopsis: Craig Freeman was charged last month with murder over the death of his wife Melinda in October 1991.

title.children: Husband charged with cold case murder of Melinda Freeman granted bail

image.altText: A man stares down the barrel of a camera while sitting in a room, wearing all black.

props.synopsis: The man who stabbed two Australian National University students in 2023 is given a nominated sentence of life to be carried out in a secure mental health facility.

title.children: ANU stabber 'may never be safe for release into the community'

image.altText: A collage of a person with disability, a hand on a wheelchair and kids throwing a ball

props.synopsis: The government confirms two categories of NDIS providers will be subject to mandatory registration, more than a year after it was handed recommendations for how to implement a new system.

title.children: 'Shape up or ship out': NDIS providers warned as new rules confirmed

image.altText: A picture of the golden FIFA World Cup trophy on a pedestal at a reception ahead of the World Cup draw.

props.synopsis: FIFA has announced a record prize money pool for the 2026 men's World Cup, but the figures are dwarfed by the riches on offer for the biggest club competitions, and fly in the face of the deadline for parity with the women's tournament.

title.children: FIFA's record men's World Cup prize pool undermines equal pay goal

image.altText: a person sitting on a rock looking at a grassy savanna

props.synopsis: The future of an isolated tourism hotspot home to stunning waterfalls and ancient rock art is uncertain following a Federal Court hearing in Darwin.

title.children: Future of isolated NT tourist hotspot uncertain following Federal Court case

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and earrings looks at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: NT Police has doubled its reward for information related to the disappearance of Angie Fuller, almost three years after her suspected murder in outback Australia.

title.children: 'We believe Angie was murdered': Fresh appeal for answers on missing mum

image.altText: Sam Kerr celebrates with teammate Johanna Rytting Kaneryd.

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr heads in the winner as Chelsea secures a spot in the Women's Champions League quarterfinals.

title.children: Kerr scores the winner for Chelsea to lock in Champions League quarterfinal

image.altText: A woman stands arms crossed in front of a pub window covered in Christmas decorations.

props.synopsis: When Leylanie moved her family back to her home town a year ago, she did not expect to be spending this Christmas still living out of a motel.

title.children: Mum pays $1,000 a week to live in a motel in her home town
